Résumé
FELIPE FRONCHETTI
Master's Student in Computer Science
São Paulo, Brazil
University of São Paulo
fronchetti@usp.br
SUMMARY
Fronchetti is a Master's Degree student in Computer Science at the University of São Paulo (USP), Brazil. His research lies in the intersection between Software Engineering (SE) and Computer Supported Cooperative Work (CSCW). He is co-(author) of 8 papers in top tier journals and conferences on Software Engineering, working on the supporting of newcomers in Open Source Software communities. He also received the Best Paper Award in the VEM 2017 Workshop.
EDUCATION
  • M.Sc. in Computer Science University of São Paulo 2018 - Current
  • B.Sc. in Computer Science University of São Paulo 2014 - 2017

PROJECTS & EXTENSIONS
  • FLUSP (MEMBER) https://flusp.ime.usp.br/ Group of graduate and undergraduate students at the University of São Paulo that aims to contribute to FLOSS projects.
  • OPEN UNIVERSE (CREATOR) https://github.com/openuniverseorg/ A platform designed to improve the attractiveness of open source projects.
